Jacob Bokor Student, Programmer, and Maker

About Me Projects

Security

I'm fascinated by cybersecurity, and most of my hobbies have something to do with it. I like to mess around with linux, networking and electronics.

Programming

I like to program in Python 3, Java, and a bit of C. All my projects are on my github, which holds them as a portfolio of the work that I've done.

Electronics

Playing around with electronics is a favorite pastime of mine, and I mess around with everything from Arduino to Raspberry Pi.

Featured Projects

Binary Clock

I built a Binary Clock while bored in computer science class, which displays the time in binary format, instead of the standard decimal. I used an RTC, or real time clock module, in order for it to keep time without being on.

Check it out

AliExpress Electronics

Me and a few of my friends built a github repo with a bunch of cheap electronics you can buy from China. It contains things like knockoff arduinos, displays, buttons, SOCs, WiFi development boards and tools.

Check it out
